fs.fibu2.view.render
Class JournalModuleLoader

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.view.render.JournalModuleLoader

public class JournalModuleLoader
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles loading of JournalModule objects by ID. It also supports dynamic loading of JournalModule classes.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Constructor Detail

JournalModuleLoader

public JournalModuleLoader()
Method Detail

getModule

public static JournalModule getModule(java.lang.String id)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.InstantiationException
Creates an instance of the module associated to this id and returns it

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If there is no module class for this id
java.lang.InstantiationException - - If the nullary constructor or the class can not be accessed

setModule

public static void setModule(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.Class<? extends JournalModule> module)
Sets the module class for the given id. If there already is a class for this id, it is overwritten. If module == null, the corresponding class is removed. If id == null, this call is ignored

loadModule

public static void loadModule(java.lang.Class<?> moduleClass)
This tries to create a JournalModule instance from the given class and will then create a mapping for its id. If there is already a mapping for this id, this call is ignored

Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - - If any error occurs during instantiation

getModuleIDs

public static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getModuleIDs()
Returns:
A list of all ids for which this loader has a mapping

getDefaultModules

public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getDefaultModules()

addChangeListener

public static void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
Adds a listener to this class. Listeners are notified, whenever a filter is added to or removed from the loader. The change event contains the corresponding filter id as source

removeChangeListener

public static void removeChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
Removes l as a listener from this class
